text.p: Winnipeg Commodity Exchange canola and grain futures pre-opening call as of 0833 CDT.

CANOLA - C$0.80 to C$1.30 a tonne lower on Prairie-wide weekend rains and cool temperatures seen conducive to crop development and lower CBOT soycomplex calls. November WCE canola crush profit margin fell to -18.06 Friday from -17.38 Thursday. Canada's dollar opened firm at C$1.3869, rose to 84.59 yen and climbed to 1.3123 marks.
FLAXSEED - C$1.00 to C$1.50 down on hedges and overbought conditions.
PEAS - Steady to US$0.50 lower on CBOT soymeal calls.
WESTERN BARLEY - C$0.10 to C$0.60 a tonne lower on CBOT corn calls with commercial short covering expected to under pin the market.
FEED WHEAT - C$0.10 to C$0.60 a tonne down on spill over pressure from WCE barley and CBOT corn calls.
(All values in Canadian dollars/tonne except peas, oats)
